{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.05218v1", "title": "Pattern avoidance in compositions and powers of permutations", "summary": "A permutation $\pi$ is said to avoid a chain $(\sigma:\tau)$ of patterns if
$\pi$ avoids $\sigma$ and $\pi^2$ avoids $\tau.$ In this paper, we define a
notion of pattern avoidance for compositions of positive integers and use that
idea to enumerate permutations of length $n$ that avoid the chain
$(312,321:\sigma)$ for any pattern $\sigma\in \bigcup_{m\geq 1} \mathcal{S}_m$.
We also enumerate those permutations that avoid the chain $(312,4321:\sigma)$
for any $\sigma\in\mathcal{S}_3.$", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-05-08T13:10:36Z"}
